meanings.definition: A graph in which the values of two variables are plotted along two axes, the pattern of the resulting points revealing any correlation present.
meanings.sent1: In science class, we learned how to interpret scattergrams to understand relationships between data points.
meanings.sent2: The scattergrams in the report showed a clear trend between temperature and ice cream sales.
meanings.sent3: The scattergrams at the math fair were so popular, they were the talk of the town!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a scattergrams of thoughts, each point representing a different idea.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful markers to make the scattergrams on the board more engaging for the students.

meanings.definition: To create a scattergram by plotting the values of two variables against each other.
meanings.sent1: Let's scattergrams the data points to see if there's a relationship between them.
meanings.sent2: She scattergrams the results on the chart to analyze the data more effectively.
meanings.sent3: The scientist decided to scattergrams the information to visualize the connections between variables.
meanings.sent4: His mind tends to scattergrams ideas, making it challenging to focus on one thing at a time.
meanings.sent5: The artist scattergrams colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful abstract painting.
